ports.name: Trigger
ports.text: Trigger the op

ports.name: Axiom / seed
ports.text: The start of the generated string

ports.name: Constant 1
ports.text: If this is encountered in the string Rule 1 is applied

ports.name: Rule 1
ports.text: String to add

ports.name: Constant 2
ports.text: If this is encountered in the string Rule 2 is applied

ports.name: Rule 2
ports.text: String to add

ports.name: Constant 3
ports.text: If this is encountered in the string Rule 3 is applied

ports.name: Rule 3
ports.text: String to add

ports.name: Constant 4
ports.text: If this is encountered in the string Rule 4 is applied

ports.name: Rule 4
ports.text: String to add

ports.name: Iterations
ports.text: Iteration amount, be careful with high numbers, the generated string is highly dependent on the Constants and Rules.

ports.name: Step length
ports.text: How far the current point moves when "F" or "f" is used

ports.name: Step scale multiplier
ports.text: Used to multiply or divide the current 'step length' whenever ">" or "<" is used

ports.name: Default angle
ports.text: The rotation amount that is used when a rotation amount isn't defined

ports.name: Rotation multiplier
ports.text: Multiplies all default angles by this amount

ports.name: random seed
ports.text: Seed used for "Random Strength" amount

ports.name: random strength
ports.text: Amount of random offset applied to position and rotation of every point

ports.name: Out trigger geometry
ports.text: Used to trigger geometry

ports.name: Line/point trigger
ports.text: Used to trigger pointCloudArray or SimpleSpline

ports.name: Points out
ports.text: An array containing all the xyz data for every point

ports.name: Max Size
ports.text: The largest distance from the starting point, can be used to make sure that the generated Lsystem is always within a bounding box. Check example file to see how this works.

ports.name: Final generated string
ports.text: The final string used to create the Lsystem
